wXsER206tUpf8PFhOyslFA.text: Fantastic spot, a little loud for a date night. We started out with my favorite, a Pimm's Cup - which was made so well. Dinner started with the Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup appetizer - really great. My boyfriend ordered the Short Rib and I went with the Roasted Chicken. There was a lot of chicken and it got a bit overwhelming. However, the stuffing was so good. I would have rather had the Short Rib! It was amazing. We ended with Chocolate covered Bacon S'mores and they made me speechless. My new sweet addiction for sure. We experienced such great service. This is a new favorite spot.

TWCVscgRM6Yg6xn69GQkiw.text: It was a few months ago I ate here and cannot remember for the life of me what my main dish was, however, I still can't get that dessert out of my mind. I had the chocolate dipped bacon s'mores and I could hardly speak during the whole 15 minutes of devouring it with my friend. Every bit was a new experience and I whole heartily recommend it!  I will be back.

x3rSw2jFxOpGWE6di8Mcvw.text: Let me start my review with a confession. The only thing that I could possibly dislike about Beckett's Table is that it's not in Denver.   Loves: - The comfy, cozy layout, nice big open kitchen where you can watch all the action, and the rustic yet sophisticated table setting with copper napkin rings, short and stocky water glasses, and vases with a simple wild flower.  - Everything on the menu. It was very difficult to choose from all the comforting stick-to-your ribs goodies like country pate, beef bourguignon, short ribs, matzo ball soup, chicken and dumplings......wow. - Five stars for the appetizers. Roasted veggies were spot-on delicious, the new spin on mac and cheese was refreshing to see, and loved how the rock shrimp enchiladas were served in a tiny cast iron skillet. - If you remember anything I say, save room for dessert! I sampled a bite of everything, and my faves were the mini s'mores with chocolate covered bacon, the pear/blueberry cobbler served in a little pot, and creme brulee. - Again with the bathrooms, Arizona. I dug the sliding doors, and the glass bricks which almost made you feel like you could look into the neighboring restroom. Is that weird? - Order an adult bev, my friends. Your mouth will thank you. - Even though we had a very large party, the waitstaff handled us with ease and I don't remember a mishap  Then why not five stars, LL Cool L, you say? It was almost, almost a five. Nearly everything was spot on except that I fumbled on ordering my main, the daily salmon special. It was definitely outshined by the atmosphere, drinks, apps, other people's dishes, and dessert.  Note: We were lucky enough to snag rock star parking, but just be aware that it's a strip mall setting so you may have to hunt for a spot. Weird, right?

xumJwdP2Lk3eDLMT8xeGpQ.text: I've been here at least half a dozen times and while I havent ever been terribly disappointed I havent really been dazzled either. Some things are really good, like the grilled cheese and tomato soup appetizer, the brussel sprouts, the beets, the noshing board. But some arent. I was not a fan of the beef bourguignon shepherd's pie or the white bass. Still, it's a really comfy place, kind of rustic and cabin-like and they have great servers. They also have some killer desserts.

Wk0-Ucn5Ouw7MOf2zgtKlQ.text: Very good experience, friendly, knowledgeable service.  We'd definitely return.  Roasted beet app was yummy, although temperature wasn't consistent through the dish (some were cold, some were hot?). Shepherd's Pie was delicious and piping hot the entire time. Both were served in cast iron.

D7gI7SPM7zb9NRStywaBHw.text: We had a take order, they told the driver they lost the order after they confirmed it. Then we were advised they did not have anymore of the food we had ordered and gave us an option then sent something totally different. The food cost a 100 bucks and was literally inedible 2 hours late and not what we ordered. I would not recommend this eatery based on this experience which was pretty disappointing

O580_mEFDjbbcwKHcKSwrA.text: Beautiful ambience and delicious food. We met another couple out for dinner and we're very impressed with the choices and food. I only took away one star due to the fact that my dish of steamed fish had little flavor. The presentation was beautiful but it lacked seasoning. The other three people having dinner all had scrumptious meals. Service was impeccable and the dessert divine!

_fpVktUNZaKYy3BeVPY0zA.text: We loved Beckett's - the atmosphere was very nice, the service was exceptional, and the food was a perfect match.  We ate the short ribs and osso buco. Both were very tasty and tender. The Beckett's Brew is very good and tastes like a light domestic beer if you're not into the craft stuff.  Finally - don't miss out on the pecan pie. Best this southern boy has ever eaten!!!

mDotXRMbFUoHLNd3DBlt-g.text: Food was very contemporary but very delicious. Had a great wine menu, small beer menu, and a unique cocktail menu. Great setting and ambiance! I had the scallops. Very delicious but small portion unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rKR0wVDAvHUuZwh5wlGF8Q.text: Social hour at Beckett's Table! Usually we eat in the restaurant but we decided to try out "social hour" a solid 3.5, I would feel horrible giving it 3 stars but 4 is a stretch.  The front desk staff amazing and the owner is always warm and sweet.  Staff worked together well (my water glass was NEVER empty) even though there is a bottle at the table they always make sure your glass is full.  Our server was a little quiet and reserved I couldn't figure it out it was a roller coaster, once you think "he's a little too curt" then he will be friendly and attentive, then we hit another low.  Specialty cocktails are very good. Cheese and bacon biscuits with apple butter (I mean how could you go wrong?) they were good with pieces of real bacon but they would have been delicious if they were warm or hot in anyway.  Grits with shrimp and sausage was good.  Crow's Dairy feta was ok as well not great I did like the roasted fennel. Brussels sprouts (my favorite vegetable) I didn't care for theirs tough and lacking of flavor.  Grilled cheese with pancetta delicious it reminded me of one I had on the street in Florence.  Plenty of cheese including the bread it was a bit salty but understandable considering what it is. Finally deviled eggs of the day, second favorite after the grilled cheese. Presentation 5 stars and so cute it was a shame to eat but I got over it quickly Decor is warm, chic and inviting.

m9r6Mo5gwgsWUwRjkfdCtQ.text: Super delicious i had the pork chop and a drink and both were great. The pork chop could have used a bit more of the potato side but I still loved it. Service was also exceptional and attentive. Would def go back here! Great place

o5U1AaqPilfl2UPlFFP6ig.text: Ordered the salmon and absolutely loved the earthy tones that the fresh and simple ingredients brought to the meal.  % recommend for those that appreciate fantastically prepared Whole Foods.

zf-70FS-RELUL6-YvaEbxA.text: I had heard this place was a good casual restaurant so decided to try it.  The people were very nice, but the menu is LOADED with Pork, Bacon and Sausage. I have never a menu that 3/4 of the items have some form of this. Three of us do not eat pork so it limited us a great deal. Also many items have dairy so if you have a dairy this place is not for you. What we did order was ok, nothing outstanding. The salmon was very fishy, the hamburger had a bad taste as there is Pork in it. They were very nice but I would not return until the chef realizes not every enjoys pork or bacon.

sAq4o5TTmebLdgUzOh7VxA.text: One of the best meals I have had in a long time. Absolutely delicious. Very fresh. Service was outstanding. I highly recommend.

GuZtCQWm5nYzE05Xe6RxuQ.text: We had a part of 7 and had a lovely dinner. The waitress kept forgetting things but the food was good. The devilled eggs were an order of 3 eggs but was actually 3 halves so a bit deceiving.

SNcZJneaJj1AZ3G0tqBqWg.text: First meal in Phoenix, and came to a restaurant that my coworkers have been to. The staff was very accommodating to the constant change in number of people attending, but luckily on a Sunday evening, it was not packed. Had a nice seating outside, communal table style.  Various appetizers, and tried the grits with sausage and brussel sprouts. Very tasty. I ordered the pork osso buco confit with the waiter and coworker's recommendation. It being served with the spaetzle was a huge plus, which was pretty good. The pork was very tender and fell off the bone. We also indulged in local AZ wine as on Sundays, bottles are half off!  My favorite part was the cheddar bacon biscuits we ordered with the apple butter. Biscuits were very flaky and delicious!  For dessert I went with the chocolate covered bacon and s'mores, a deconstructed version. I don't like marshmallows, but these were homemade and tasted super different than Kraft, in a good way! Whipped peanut butter and graham crackers were excellent as well. I tasted my coworker's peach cobbler, and that was even yummier!   Great ambience, superb service, and delicious food! Excellent start to welcome us to Phoenix!

bnLkl2U9qbUhgNg__H06Mg.text: The atmosphere was fantastic as well as the service but the food needs some work. We got the pork osso buco confit which was very tender and falling off the bone.. But it lacked flavor and taste ...... I have had pork on many occasions and never had it so flavorless .... also tried the Mac and cheese which lacked cheese was more like an Alfredo it was good if u want Alfredo not Mac and cheese ....redemption came with the bacon bourbon apple crisp with a lovely cup of coffee

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8N9ZRPWZ20TjuCxeL00G9Q.text: Parmesan and Onion Rolls, Rye Rolls, Sweet Butter Locally Milled Super Creamy Grits & Schreiner's Sausage -Mustard Jus Becketts Original Grilled Cheese - Pancetta, four Cheeses, roasted Red Pepper Tomato Soup Beckett's Table Signature Fork Tender Short Ribs - creamy mashed Potatoes, sauteed Veggies, Red Onion Demi-glace Pork Osso Buco Confit - roasted Garlic & Black Pepper Spaetzle, Butternut Squash, Golden Raisin Pepita Gremolata Kid's Cheeseburger and French Fries Bacon Cheddar Biscuits - Apple Butter Wood oven roasted Bacon Biscuit Stuffing Chocolate Dipped Bacon S'mores - house-made Marshmallow, Caramel whipped Peanut Butter, Graham Cracker Award Winning Fig & Pecan Pie - Beckett's original Citrus Zest Cream Cheese Ice Cream  Exiting Glendale early, The Buckeyes warranting neither applause nor a battle with traffic when laying an egg at the Fiesta Bowl, it was at Beckett's Table that consolation was found as the East Coast celebrated 2017, an a la carte three-course meal served with no price hikes by smiling servers from a Chef whose comfortable American cuisine continues to do Phoenix proud.  Conceptualized as an honest kitchen built on the idea of family and friends, its 2010 opening seemingly far longer than just a little over six years ago, Beckett's table was formed as the result of two couples with a passion for food, beverage and the city they inhabit, most of the ingredients brought in from no more than thirty miles away while Northern Arizona's growing number of Wineries become more and more prevalent on a sizeable drink list.  All blonde wood and bricks with a open kitchen in the rear, a style familiar to many modern-American kitchens, it was moments prior to a nine o'clock reservation that the party checked in with a doorside hostess, a quick path past several well-dressed  locals seating three at a square table with a good view of the pass, Chef Justin and his team working diligently with more attention to detail that rumors have suggested, a nightly special of skewered Pig Trotters unfortunately just sold-out, though the menu still presented plenty of choices.  Dining with one wide awake youngster and his mother, a bargain glass of Sparkling Wine starting the night's celebration, it from a friendly middle-aged woman that a basket of warm Bread was delivered, the cheesy Onion Rolls quite nice while dark Rye Rolls were event better, particularly as a means for sopping the leftover Sauce from a bowl of creamy Grits, grilled Sausage and light notes of Mustard.  Unable to ignore one of several self-designated signatures amongst the starters, "Beckett's Original Grilled Cheese" served crunchy with a smooth center alongside piquant Tomato Soup made for dipping, entrees arrived shortly thereafter with "Beckett's Table Signature Fork Tender Short Ribs" and a sizable hunk of confit Pork Osso Bucco, the competition for which was richer essentially a toss-up, though tilted in favor of the Beef as the buttery Potato puree seemed more decadent than the springy Garlic and Black Pepper Egg Noodles.   More than a little surprised by a generously portioned Cheeseburger and French Fries from the Kid's menu, a decision to double down on Bacon Cheddar Biscuits and oven-roasted Stuffing made from  day-olds proving well worth it as each set a high-standard for American Holiday staples, dessert saw deconstructed Peanut Butter, Bacon S'mores that would have benefitted from housemade Graham Crackers presented next to nothing short of a brilliant idea, the "Award Winning" Pecan Pie with a Fig Jam base made all the more enchanting be a lightly charred  Crust and a tangy ball of Ice Cream.

2fZ6UW0eLoHJMw_42hnSUA.text: I came here for happy hour with a group of girls and had a great experience. I ordered a glass of rose and a side of the famous biscuits (they were amazing!!). I recommend this place for a cozy happy hour spot with great specials.  The only downfall was the seating area. There was basically one big table and a few bar stools at the bar.

29dB0rEdcSfM4Mt3Qj3uZw.text: I just went here for the first time for a company Christmas outing.   The service was great! Pablo was very attentive. The music was awesome too and the right volume level.   The food, on the other hand, was okay at best. I expected more considering the insanely high prices, but I could have had a much more delicious meal for much less elsewhere. The Mac and cheese was dry, the Brussels sprouts were hard, and the stuffing under the petite skillet chicken tasted just awful.   Nice atmosphere but not recommended for your wallet or your tastebuds!!!

0Akl9GNe8cXK887lagXtFA.text: We have been here twice, so my opinion is fairly solid. The food is just okay, the wait staff is fine. But it was still over 100 degrees outside and more than a third of the tables were reserved without people sitting inside for the whole time we had our meal outside. We agreed, so its not their fault to seat us outside. But is a raging fire really necessary outside in September? We moved three tables down and still felt the heat waves...ugggh. Mac and cheese is ok, but a watermelon salad that is about $15 should come with more than an eighth of the plate. Watermelon is not that expensive, right? Also, I don't remember reading that there were frozen green bell peppers on top with the feta, and it was really odd. I guess the bright side is that I didn't have to suffer through a large salad!!

Vl5wPGvmFl6x0r1JxYfmMA.text: I absolutely love the atmosphere here, the cocktails are nicely done, and the food is delicious. I've had both slow roasted osso buco pork and short ribs both were very tender cooked to perfection.

Es_bYFLfmJ4QPvdfSjxAkg.text: The Mac n' cheese is in a light sauce with bacon - its awesome. We thought we'd miss the usual thick cheese sauce but we didn't. The cheddar bacon biscuits serves with an apple spread were incredibly tasty. Just the right amount of salt and sweet and the biscuits had a super crustiness. The noble toast didn't go over as well. It  lacked flavor. The scallops were cooked perfectly but the accompanying chorizo was a little spicy for my son. The shrimp and grits were really good though my other son found the grits too creamy. But lots of folks like it that way! The chicken was awesome - juicy and flavorful.

TBviV8mmLPFk6pieMUSeWw.text: Visited the first time during restaurant week. My daughter had been there numerous times and wanted us to try it. We had reservations and unfortunately we were seated about 30 after the reservation time. While we were sitting in the lobby waiting the manager apologized and brought each of us a glass of champagne to enjoy while we waited. I have absolutely no complaints about the wait as it was a busy week for them, and sitting enjoying the champagne and relaxing was a great start to a enjoyable evening. Food was delicious,  and we have been back a couple other times and recommend it our friends

LxWUixAUsXn8XaCZT954wQ.text: (Lyrics - Madonna - Like A Virgin)  I made it to the restaurant Somehow I'm made to Yelp..... Didn't know how lost I was Until I found you  I want to eat in Phoenix I'd been had, I was hungry and blue But you made me feel Yeah, you made me feel Happy and full  Beckett's Table Tried for my very first time Beckett's Table When Bo Bites eats  Next to rhyme!  Beckett's Table is located in the heart of what I call a food mecca!  Next to Crudo's, the Market by Jennifer's and The Vig.  Anyways, I came here for a quick dinner bite with some friends.  My partner and I decided to share since we weren't that hungry.  We went for the House Made Ricotta Berry Salad and the Tuscan Shrimp.  Needless to say, the salad was well plated and an artwork to look at.  Eat with your eyes first they say and indeed we did.  The salad was plated more like a charcuterie board with a sweet strawberry puree dotted on the side; we mixed it with the arugula and spiced pistachios and soft semi-goowy ricotta cheese.  Overall, a good start to wet the palate for things to come!  Our entree came as a soup; shrimp, sausage, roasted tomatoes and beans and atop with a parmesan crustini.  I thought this dish was good, but it was nothing too exciting.  I thought it needed some heat and some extra crunch.  I appreciated the beans, but later thought I need some more texture.    In the end, Beckett's Table is still a place that deserves my love.  I love the rustic American feel and open kitchen.  The place is warm and welcoming. Service seems knowledgeable and definitely on top of things -- I drink a lot of water and not once was my water glass empty! - Enjoy!

Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ByP2wPw3yuF6ytsPOXrRng.text: I wanted to like this place, but the food is absolutely mediocre. I got their so called "famous" grilled cheese, which tasted like a bagel from Einstein's- not particularly exciting. Another notable item was something resembling Thanksgiving stuffing- it was just fried bits of bread with celery and a few other things- very dry, very pointless. Why would you make a professional meal out of that. Service was good, that's the only thing I'm giving two stars for. This dull food does not deserve the dubiously positive reputation it has.

-mqRLf7WLjJD4QV01-mC6w.text: Thoroughly disappointed! After the reviews and wanting to try this place for a couple of years, last night was a HUGE let down. The food was OK, but overpriced for what it is. Portions seemed small for the price.  The decor was typical "American New" and nice.   The service was horrible. I got my drink quick, but my gf waited 15 min to get her wine. Our waitress was nice, but she acted like she was new and missed a lot of things. She was apologetic at the end of the meal, but didn't offer a discount or free desert or any kind of explaination. Were they severely understaffed? This place didn't look slammed to me. We were there just over 2 hours which is about 45 min longer than it should have taken. Not a great impression for restaurant week.  Most likely won't go back...

2sr7oqqj5sGIVRT9Vgring.text: Pork oso buco!! Best item on menu  So tender & juicy!!!  Husband got the cheeseburger & fries.  It was insanely good!!  We ordered a ton of aps for the group  I loved the fried deviled eggs & chicken meatballs The peach & cheese ap was delish but small  White sangria was perfect- 2 glasses for 13  This place has delish & reasonable options & very cute setting  Will be back for sure  Server was top-notch too

ehOe2Z1EB-DLuAvvfasyyw.text: One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. We ate here for Restaurant Week. We will be returning for sure. The Pork Osso Buco is worthy of spot on Olympus. Our second favorite was the short rib. The flavor is out of control. Not sure if they always have it but the corn soup was way better than expected. The favorite dessert was the pecan pie. They have a great wine list too.

MzZ4ljlsZMN9uN2vK2WHAA.text: This was truly the most bizarre experience I have had at a restaurant. We asked for chicken tenders, they wouldn't give us any because they had "only child portions". So bring us a bigger one....? We asked for broccoli and she said they couldn't give us any unless we ordered salmon. We literally couldn't order any sides unless we ordered a full meal? Then they said they had gluten free options on all the sandwiches. No they don't!! They just replace the bread with lettuce. That's not the same thing.... this Restaurant  just needs to restock their kitchen it seems like.

cfZVcFuNyoOc_RddMX4_Jg.text: One more recent Phoenix landmark to knock off my checklist.  Nice open social space.  Good attention to detail by wait staff.  My Osso Bucco and spaetzle meal was proof that Germans and Italians can create great things together.  In spite of the length of my restaurant to-do list I will make sure that this place gets more visits.  And yes, the parking lot does suck.

Gt75B_4ymRIv7Q3ybZCkEw.text: This was our second time at Beckett's Table. I still loved it as much as the first time. We all met for some pre-dinner drinks at the bar. It's crowded, so know that going in. Beckett's has very cool drinks and wines. I started with a house Pinot Noir and my boyfriend a simple IPA. Our friends ordered some of the various mixed drinks and I sampled a few; strong! Since I'm not much of a mixed drink girl, I'm happy with my Pinot and the wine selection here is awesome! We moved on to our table and ordered a few apps. We had the Mac cheese with pancetta: a melt in your mouth delight! We had the deep fried deviled eggs: different and I'm a fan! The biscuits and apple butter: if your gonna splurge, these biscuits are to die for! The grilled cheese with the small bowl of tomato soup for dipping: I thot the bread was too thick, but everyone else loved them. For dinner, the fork tender short ribs are huge and so, so tender. They are presented atop a mashed potato, baby brussel sprouts and carrots. I've had the Osso Bucco before and both of these meat dishes are a total treat. My friend who was visiting from Hawaii, had sangria and the butter salad. I tested it and it was light and very good. The sangria was also great, light and refreshing! To finish our meal, my boyfriend and I had the Coconut Cake. Yum. Decadence in one bite kind of yum. It is a moist cake with coconut sided with coconut pudding and dark chocolate swirled around. Need I say more? Our friends had the Smores: smores with peanut butter and chocolate dipped bacon. I think its a bit weird and not a fan, but they loved it. It's nice to "Come Together" as the pins say on the tables, and have a neuvo American food place be trendy with comfort food classics.

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmm ... The Coconut Cake ... Sided with coconut pudding; cashew butter and ice cream and a smudge of hot fudge ...

0uI0c1jzDFC2HR7QwXQlfQ.text: Great food! Good service. The hosts and hostess's are another story. They just aren't super friendly or welcoming. Its very odd and uncomfortable, and it makes for a very awkward start to what is supposed to be a nice experience.   It won't stop us from coming back, but I'm hoping the owners do something to change this as I see I am not the only patron making that complaint. Otherwise, I'd be giving it 5 stars.

TW7Wy_owWWwkEfxvxnVIwQ.text: I've been here a couple of times and while some things are consistently great (the short ribs, the pork oso buco) other things are really not so great. I had the Chicken and Dumplings and it should actually just be called Dumplings. Not much chicken at all. My husband once got a special Cassoulet and had to send it back because it was all white beans and very little pork. Even the waitress agreed.  We went with a large group and were over charged for a bottle of wine we did not drink so we had to ask for them to take that off. That same night I got home and realized I had also been overcharged for a drink at the bar (it was still Happy Hour...or Social Hour...or whatever they call it).   Speaking of the Social Hour, it is really annoying that it is only at certain areas of the restaurant. We got there once during the Social Hour and ordered drinks at our table. We were then told Social Hour only applies if you order drinks at the bar or are sitting at a special table. This just seems silly to me. Everyone else is also right that the host guy is not friendly AT ALL. We have had friendly waitstaff pretty consistently though.   After a couple of lackluster trips I don't think we will be returning, which is a bummer because this place is really close to our house and it could be so much better! Lots of potential...

E8OenKEqLobjHZT42kV3Hg.text: This is a great date restaurant!  Our server was fantastic, and very personable.  The cocktails were delicious.  The food was out of this world!!  Great atmosphere, too.  We will definitely be back.

cD13G4Gpjl9SIZOUtOdzGA.text: This is hands down my husband's favorite restaurant and in my top five. We've been here five times and each time is amazing. We have never had a bad dish. My favorite is the pork osso buco. I am not a fan of pork or really any meat on the bone, but this dish is AMAZING. Ever since I discovered it I haven't been able to order anything else because I love it so much. Between my husband and I, we've had the short ribs, cast iron chicken, chicken and dumplings and pork chop. Our favorites are the pork osso buco and the cast iron chicken, but we haven't had a bad dish yet.  The atmosphere is very low key classy. Its the kind of place where you can dress up or be casual and not feel out of place. It's fancy food, but it fills you up and when you get the dish you actually know how to eat it. For the quality of the food, it is actually a really decent price too. The service is always great as well.  Like I said this is our favorite restaurant, so much so that this is where we went the night that we got engaged. We didn't want to make a big deal about it, but the waiter made everything feel special and intimate, without making a spectacle out of it. I wish I would remember his name but was obviously distracted. Now it is our special restaurant that we go to for all of our special occasions. Its relaxing, intimate, cozy and a little fancy all at this same time.

ZK8wlekf8cI55pQ33wJWLA.text: I have been here numerous times but somehow I forgot to write reviews for this place. Well let me do so now. There is a reason I come here approximately once a month or so. This place has everything that it should:  1.) Fantastic ever changing dishes made with fresh ingredients which are more often than not local to Arizona (supporting our local farmers here is very important)  2.) The culinary menu is varied enough that seems to have food for the healthy, the carnivore, the vegetarian, the light or heavy eater. they also have one of the best kid's menus I have ever seen  3.) Their cocktail list seems to have a bit of a theme but varied enough that anyone who enjoys their libations can find something they'll like  4.) The wine list is awesome... they again support local vineyards here in Arizona and have a special HH dedicated to promoting them. as for the other varietals, they are varied from new world to old, from the common to the exotic and of course they make sure that there is a price range that anyone can afford  5.) An ambiance that makes you feel like your family member or close friend is right over that expo kitchen counter cooking just for you. The seating is openly arranged in a way that it is cozy but spacious as well. The use of wood almost everywhere can only be pulled off by certain types of places and this is one of them. Kudos to the designer  6.) Last but not least, the people that work here seem to be just the types of people I would hire myself. Knowledgeable, sincere, gracious, and hard working, the majority of this staff knows that they are not novices (reason I say most is because there is one server that is "full of himself" and it shows).  All in all, this is one of my favorite gems in the Greater Phoenix Area here in the beautiful state of Arizona. We are proving to the rest of the country bit by bit that Arizona is where it's at.. food, people, scenery, activities, etc. I love being an Arizonan!!

x10D_0bg8fgOmrLqLDGMpg.text: I'm currently breastfeeding and am on a super restrictive diet due to my little ones tummy issues.  I've had a really hard time finding places that fit my gluten free, soy free and dairy free needs.  The chef was super accommodating and steered me toward the white bass - hands down the best fish I've ever had. My hubby had the short ribs and couldn't stop talking about how good they were.  This is our new favorite place.

xCyO2nWtAp-zNEnqBF1umQ.text: Great restaurant, from its food to the ambiance. The menu is quite small and changes seasonally, but you will still have a hard time choosing what you want to eat as everything looks delicious! They also have a few Arizona wines, drink locally!

y3sOQDbnoCs0_a7zsug7sw.text: Holy moly. One of the best restaurants we tried on our roadtrip around the Southwest!! Yelp did not let us down! Made a reservation on Open Table. Smooth process and would recommend making a reservation just to be sure.   I had the osso buco with spinach spaetzle and the Mr. had the short ribs. Apparently the short ribs are cooked for 12 hours. Great googly moogly... That's a long time!! Knives are completely unnecessary afore both dishes as the meats just falls off the bone. Extra super tasty... And crap!!! I just realized I left my leftovers in the hotel room. Dangit! I was looking forward to a second go around.   Pumpkin porter was tasty. Tastes just like fall to me. Spicy and full flavored. Stella on draught was as expected and refreshing.   Dessert. Let me tell you about the dessert. Get it. Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert. Holy farking ships... It was the best. The mister had the chocolate covered bacon smores. I had the toasted coconut cake. Perfect in every way!   Service was amazing. Drinks overfloweth and we were never needing to flag anyone down. Pamela gave great recommendations and was adequately attentive. I wouldn't have had it any other way!   For sure we'd eat here again when in town.

4ttGkYv3G2SNOA7epzy45Q.text: This is my number one favorite restaurant! The menu is so original and the food not only tastes great but is served so beautifully. The staff is all so genuine and kind. Very romantic! My fiance proposed to me here. We love it.

DpWmeaVT_rBaohndW_jv3g.text: I came here the other week while on a business trip to Phoenix. A coworker of mine recommended it and it did not disappoint!   Our table of 4 started with a few appetizers.  We had:  - organic brussels sprouts, lemon vinaigrette, pancetta  - beckett's original grilled cheese, pancetta (aka bacon), four cheeses, roasted red pepper tomato soup - chicken meatballs & smoky tomato sauce, roasted onions, eggplant & peppers, bread crumbs  I did not try the grilled cheese (though I did try the roasted red pepper soup/dip, yumm!), but the brussel sprouts (minus pancetta, I don't eat pork) and the chicken meatballs were delicious!  For the main course, my table of 3 big guys + me was heavy on the pork. All 3 of them ordered a different pork dish (they have a lot of pork on the menu!) and I went with the beef braised short ribs. I was going to be good and get fish, but when the waiter described the short ribs I couldn't resist. They were so flavorful and so tender that I've dreamed about that dish since! Dish descriptions:  - fire roasted green chile pork stew, corn bread, cotija cheese - pork osso buco confit grilled apple spaetzle, pepper reduction - roasted & grilled pork chop*, griddled grit cake, braised greens - fork tender short ribs, mashed potatoes, roasted root veggies, red wine reduction  I did not try any of the pork dishes, but reviews from my coworkers were off the charts. I would order the short ribs again in a heart beat.  The service was also exceptional. One of the most enjoyable meals I've had in Phoenix, I'd highly recommend checking out Beckett's Table!

jZzsMXS-XgZxgyNXQllsKg.text: Finally I got to try this place! I really wanted to sit outside next to the fireplace, but it was raining (so I let it slide..this time). One of the main things I was really excited about was trying the chocolate covered bacon, our server (I wish I remembered his name) gave me a sample since I was talking about it so much and it was so good!  I have to say, our server was awesome and I give him props for dealing with 3 obnoxious girls.   We ordered the chicken meatballs, definitely good but I would rather try something else next time.  My friend ordered the mussels, they were yummy! I definitely recommend that if you are in the mood for seafood :) (Even though it won't be the best of the best :P). My other friend convinced me to split with her ( I wish I didn't, I was still so hungry), anywhoooo...we ended up splitting the short ribs and sweet jesus it was amazing! Oh and the mashed potatoes were so addictive to where I ordered an extra side of  it.. *fatty*.   Lastly for dessert, we ordered the pumpkin spice creme brulee... and WOW, I am going to be coming back here JUST for that, it was one of the best desserts my mouth has ever encountered.  All in all, great experience and great service! *my drinks were never empty; in general, we never had to wait.   I will definitely be back here again for not only the food but  definitely before the pumpkin spice creme brulee goes byebyeeee.   P.S. I will be posting pictures up soon :o

Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pumpkin spice creme brulee
