4EBvGfWh-IUigclbQcib1A.text: Too much "Foo Foo" and not enough substance. Deep fried hard boiled eggs, sausage cooked in grits or brussel sprouts are not my idea of appetizers that you would enjoy with a glass or two of wine. The meat main courses were okay but the side dishes like the spinach spaetzle was bland with no flavor. My wife had the Ahi Tuna and wouldn't eat it because it tasted like it was spoiled. It may have been the spices or sauces and she normally loves Ahi, but not this night.   The guy at the front door needs to get a job in the back kitchen where he doesn't  have to deal with people but once you get past him the rest of the staff were absolutely wonderful and did great job.   None of the four of us will go back because the menu was just too "over the top" but it obviously appeals to a lot of others because the place was packed. I am not saying that you shouldn't try Beckett's but make sure you read their menu on line first because it may just be too "Foo Foo" for your taste!

kDm-RHp_gnafEc2lmUWPyg.text: Brrr. Bring a sweater or wear long sleeves; no sweating here as their AC pumps a solid 70 degrees or lower. Parking on a busy Friday night required a bit of patience but was not a hassle. Service was prompt and polite. Post- meal hovering resulted in one less star. No coffee was offered, and multiple waitstaff glances at our foodless table left me feeling more rushed than relaxed. The menu was amazing! Darn near every wine they have is offered by the glass. What a plus for we winos. We chose and shared Mac n cheese, grits and sausage, and Caprese salad to start. The Mac portion was dinner sized, the others were appetizer appropriate and sooo tasty. I chose roast chicken for dinner. Fall off the bone tender, vegetable- infused flavor satisfied to the max. The frozen caramel parfait topped off the evening with a perfectly sized bit of sweetness. Satisfied not stuffed. Thanks BT!

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon S&#39;mores! Mmmmm.
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caprese and deviled egg!

virPYVast0Q26lFevWNfWg.text: Love this place! The ambience, the food, the people. I like them on Facebook so I get updates and sneak peeks of their upcoming menu! I live nearby and go as often as I can. I've never ordered anything that wasn't awesome! One of my favorite places in Phoenix!

dw0-Db2e5Ld8Tnt__azgQg.text: really enjoyed my first visit to Beckett's Table. You can tell the owners are professional restaurateurs, the presentation is impeccable and precise from start to finish. All the little touches are definitely noticed.  The only criticism I have is that I really did not care for the lemonade. It is sweetened with honey and at least the drinks we had were WAY heavy on the honey, it was more like honeyade.  The mac and cheese with pancetta is a MUST. Pancetta is NOT bacon, it's much better! In fact quite a few dishes use the pancetta, for which I am grateful. Looking forward to a return visit!

pTpxKRn5Dl3qAujAKXuhoA.text: Aggravating.  Bad service.  Been there twice and the male wait staff are incredibly arrogant and lazy.  Wouldn't even split up the check when asked.  Will not go back.

Mpcd0vCBUlCdH8p_qytByA.text: What a fantastic experience!  Arrived a little on the later side on a Tuesday evening and the place was busy and fun.  Food was amazing and our server, Pamela,deserves giant kudos, she was lovely, knowledgable and just all around delightful- clearly enjoys creating a wonderful dining experience.  I live in the SF Bay Area and my dining companions are foodies who are very particular and they loved this place!

uxdymxmK41L4O2u02BUsfQ.text: Wednesday, October 27, 2010. Opening Night.  As we walked in we were greeted by Michelle Beckett (owner/partner) and she had even recognized me from my comment on their facebook page. This meant a lot because it shows that they are taking time and investing in the utilization of social networking. They want to know their customers and build the relationships to become that "neighborhood hangout," or a True Third Place.   The decor of the building is absolutely perfect. The dark wood, exposed trusses, brick wall, open kitchen are all inviting and comforting. They did a good job of expressing their business concept in their design; they aren't trying to be pretentious or snooty. They are down to earth and simple with the decor and aesthetics which leads them into being a comfortable neighborhood hangout. I was impressed with the wait staff. They were knowledgeable and had tried everything on the menu. This allowed them to give recommendations and answer questions. Likewise, they weren't your typical high school or college servers. They were seasoned wait staff, and it was apparent. My only comment on the service would be that the timing was a little bit off from ordering 1st course, 2nd course, and the time for our after dinner cocktails. However, these are minimal kinks I would expect on night one, so I see it as a nonissue.   Now for the food. The four of us decided to share the Beckett's Original Grilled Cheese ($9). This grilled cheese had four cheeses and pancetta. It was delicious, and the roasted red pepper soup to accompany was great. This plays a lot into Beckett's concept. It's not food that you can't make at home, he's just going to do it a little better, and for a fare price.  We ordered a bottle of Page Springs Grenache ($41). It was very nice to see a handful of local wines on the list, this is something that I think all local restaurants should strive to do. It was nice to see chef Justin Beckett be able to escape the kitchen and make rounds in the dining room to greet his guests and thank them for coming, etc.  For our main courses we had the Wood Fired Mussels ($18), Fork Tender Short Ribs ($19), Local Pork Osso Buco Confit, and Chicken n Dumplings ($16). The mussels were great. It seems a lot of restaurants are serving mussels in a white wine broth these days (Beckett's Table, Iruna, Liberty Market, etc.). Each of them does it a little bit different, and Beckett's take on this dish is using a fennel broth. Normally I am not a fan of fennel, but it was mild enough, and with the other spices it was a good combination. My only concern (not even a complaint) was the portion of the dish. I had 32 mussels in my bowl. I spoke with Justin after we ate and he mentioned that that was not the correct amount.  However, we discussed portioning and he is definitely being generous with the amount of mussels in this dish. I'd say it's a great deal! The short ribs were cooked to perfection, and lived up to the name "fork tender." They were seasoned well with a nice bite of cracked black pepper. A very generous portion as well. The pork osso buco was delicious. It was tender and flavorful. Its side of butternut squash spaetzle was a nice touch. My little brother ordered the chicken n dumplings. These were delicious, and Beckett's take on this nostalgic dish includes saffron in the cream sauce. It created a very smooth flavor that definitely set it apart from all other chicken n dumplings (except our family recipe, of course).   We thought about dessert... and well... we had to. Chocolate dipped bacon s'mores. Wow. Another great taste combination, taking the smokey, salty flavor of the bacon and dipping it in the sweet chocolate was great. Their marshmallows are house-made, which is just a nice touch. It did come with a dollop of peanut butter whipped cream that complimented the dish.   Likewise, we ordered after dinner cocktails. I ordered the Legend City Cocktail. The name is something that will be nostalgic for those that have grown up in the Valley. This drink I feel was a great twist on a classic Old Fashioned. It was Woodford bourbon, Ricard, bitters and a splash of lemonade: served straight up. I thought it was delicious, but I have began to acquire a bias for classic bourbon cocktails. My mom ordered Miss Katie's Pimms Cup. This drink is named after one of the owning partners Katie Stephens, who also came around to our table and introduced herself and chatted with us for a few minutes. My dad, growing up on a farm appreciated and ordered the AZ Farmhand. It contains Hendricks Gin, ginger, lemonade, honey syrup and a splash of soda. Very refreshing drink as well.  I will be back Beckett and his staff have done a GREAT job opening this new neighborhood hangout.

3VPJj6BIc6-y_Wwd0eX9Mg.text: It's a brilliant concept, really, non-threatening food (brussels sprouts are probably the scariest thing on the menu) given an interesting tweak here and there to make it worthy of a night out. And judging from the crowd that showed up on a rainy Sunday evening, it's working. The diners were a mixed bunch: lots of families with their kids, lots of singles at the community table. Chef Justin Beckett, formerly of Canal, his wife and some friends took over the space previously occupied by That's Italiano, a restaurant that deserved to close. They did a lovely renovation, with exposed wood beams, an open kitchen, lots of windows, and the above mentioned community table, made from a fallen black walnut tree. To put you in a good mood there's a number of specialty cocktails, a nice wine list, and 4 draught beers, plus others by the bottle. Our server, Allison, was delightful - very funny, but also very professional. The menu isn't large, but it was hard to make a selection since everything sounds good. An interesting appetizer entry is Beckett's Original Grilled Cheese served with roasted red pepper tomato soup ($9). Creamy Grits & Spicy Andouille Sausage ($8) was tempting. Ken opted to get two appetizers for his meal, the Chef's Country Pate ($8) and those scary Roasted Brussels Sprouts with pancetta, shaved manchego cheese and lemon thyme vinaigrette ($6). I thought it strange that this was considered an appetizer. For me, the Crisp Butter Lettuce Salad, green grapes, toasted pecans, candied lemon vinaigrette ($6) and a side of Mac and Cheese ($5, as are all the side dishes including the bacon cheddar biscuits which we ordered while trying to decide on the rest of our meal). Our friend Sena decided, after much pondering, on the pork osso bucco ($17). And Leon ordered his usual hamburger - in this case the "B" Burger with Buttered Brioche, Boursin, Bib lettuce, Beefsteak tomato ($13). So how was it? The biscuits, which arrived first were a good omen. They were more scone-like than biscuity, but they were delicious, especially with the accompanying apple honey butter. Ken enjoyed his pate, which came with lots of things to eat with it, including peanut brittle. Sena's osso bucco was delicious, tender and rich. The only problem was that the carrots served in the roasted vegetable medley were terribly undercooked. The same was True, to a lesser extent, of the brussels sprouts plus they were pretty much tasteless. The vinaigrette on my salad was outstanding, but the grapes and pecans were in short supply. Leon said his burger was just okay, but he seems to feel that way about most of the burgers he orders. One day we'll find him one that will knock his socks off! If anybody has any suggestions, please let me know. The entrees didn't live up to the biscuits, but I had high hopes for dessert ($5 each). There's a strange one - Chocolate Dipped Bacon S'Mores with caramel, housemade marshmallow, whipped peanut butter, and graham crackers. But I had to go with the Fig & Pecan Pie which came with cream cheese and citrus zest ice cream. This was delectable, rich but not too sweet. I usually don't like cream cheese ice cream, but this was a perfect match for the pie and the citrus zest just sung out. Loved it. Ken grumbled a little about the poor selection of tea, and the fact that there was no espresso. All things considered, despite the negatives, I'd go back. I have the feeling that things will get better and better. Beckett's Table 3717 E. Indian School Phoenix 602-954-1700 (reservations are a good idea) 5 - 10PM Tuesday through Sunday beckettstable.com

Cc-srDIm0C6NfVf92_JgDg.text: Camped out at a table for hours with clients and never felt rushed by the amazing service even thought it was Valentine's. In fact, our meal was carefully orchestrated for perfect timing by our server so that every course came out just when we were ready. The appetizers were perfect for sharing, full of flavor and priced reasonably so that we could order several (we ordered off 5 on the menu). The main courses were very flavorful as well and were the perfect portion sizes to ensure dessert would be the cards. Favorites were the grilled cheese ap, the short ribs entree and the smores w/ bacon dessert. Will go back again for sure.

fhzYkCPk90eqTCPimUBSmg.text: Way over-hyped and over-priced, save your money

ELIq8lc4bru-oeA5xVuIWw.text: Had a special occasion dinner here and was fully disappointed.  I worked in the food industry for over 10 years and this place is terrible.    The only good thing was the water at best!  To top it all off 4 out of 6 of us got sick after eating the food.  It is way over priced for such amateur service and boring food.  Should of just gone next door to Zipps!

4XPcflnokmgUARgvk7yG-w.text: My husband and I had an incredible meal at Beckett's Table during our time in AZ two weeks ago. The food was delicious and we are still kicking ourselves for not going back once more before leaving. Two meals here would have been so much better than one.

GgjQLkPYa4KmGvBjk5R4uw.text: I am very excited about the addition of this new restaurant in " my hood"-lower Arcadia. I am such a lazy person when it comes to traveling far for a good meal so when I heard about Beckett's Table I was anxious to give it a try. No disappointment here! The place is heaven. Lovely warm atmosphere-urban without the pretense. The service casual but efficient. And the food....the perfect combination of comfort and elegance. We had the outrageous biscuits to start with our lovely cocktails, the lobster enchiladas-(delicious taste but I missed the lobster..) and the perfectly prepared salmon. Too  full to try the pecan pie-had the creme brulee-which was creamy goodness but would have liked an accompanying fruit or something with it. The menu had so many things I wanted to try-I will be back again and again. Prices are reasonable-2 drinks, biscuits, one appetizer,one entree, 2 desserts all for less than 70.00.

xAEUVHLKpiE20t1M3Ugp6g.text: Two words: short ribs.  You haven't lived until you've had them here.  The substantial portion will leave you with plenty to take home for left overs too!    Loved the atmosphere of this place, great service, and NO VALET which is a small miracle in Phoenix these days.  I'm more than capable of parking my own car and glad that Beckett's table let's me do just that.  It's the little things... :)

pUJ_YXRKnpwwAcBGnSwoxg.text: Fantastic interesting food. The first time we went the kitchen shut down before dinner due to a tech issue. But they gave us vouchers for free dinner so we went back and had a great meal. Kudos for great food but more importantly appreciating your customers and making them happy. Although the kitchen issue was not the restaurant's fault, they made the effort to compensate us for our time!!

TNJrP5i923g02rM7rtZpTw.text: If I could, I would give a 3 1/2.  The food was good, but not fantastic.  The menu is limited, and I had a difficult time choosing what to get.  I finally decided to get the short ribs, and switched out my side for brussel sprouts.  (which I was grateful that they did).  All in all, the food is decent, the space is great, and has an urban feel (other than the TV, and the outdoor seating next to the parked cars).  The service was extremely friendly, but unpolished.  It's always best when service goes unnoticed.  Not sure I'll be back due to the limited menu.

HT2D2POITR5Ex9yZ1xIgpA.text: Wow great food and really nice staff. (Ricardo especially!)  Finally a restaurant without disappointment. Everyone at the table loved their dish and deserts were amazing! (We shared three) Coffee Creme Brulee and Pecan Fig Pie with Cream Cheese Ice Cream..Ooooh La La!  Would have been 5 stars but took the "Canelloni " (stuffed red peppers really) home to my Vegetarian Dad and it was way too small (appetizer , really...)  Need more vegetarian entrees people. This is 2011 y'all :) Turkey burger option for non-cow eaters would be great too :) :)

YTi7HmMZhXQCIWIKadZGOg.text: The rib-sticking southern style menu makes one worry they'll need a quadruple bypass by the end of their meal -- or at least a cardiologist standing nearby. The food is surprisingly light, non-greasy and lightly salted, so put away the defibrillator and order a hefty side of Mac & Cheese with Crispy Pancetta or Apple & Red Onion Spaetzle to go with your Chicken & Dumplings, Short Ribs or Green Chile Pork Stew. My favorite menu item the Fig & Pecan pie with cream cheese ice cream. So good I returned the next night for more. Chef Justin Beckett not only wows customers with his healthy home-style cooking, but also with his outgoing personality, regularly visiting customers table side and explaining how he prepares things like the tuille "sand" that accompanies his colorful, yet simple beet salad. Definitely save room for desert, or be ready to return the next evening to finish what you started. This restaurant is on my hit list now for every visit to the Phoenix area.

0a305h2obpWkB03ITXMPHw.text: GREAT food, great feel to the interior (actual location exterior wise is a bit random though), and excellent preparation and imagination. This hard to impress foodie was IMPRESSED. Will come back many times. Has a Chelsea's Kitchenesque feel to it but its definitely its own restaurant. If you like "new" American cuisine, stop in...

vEzICa2HT0JbYAxvAh8BLg.text: Quite simply, Beckett's Table gets it right. We had been looking forward to trying it after watching them work on the space for several months and finally had the chance to eat there on a busy Saturday night. Everything from the appetizer (grits and andouille sausage) to the entrees (short ribs and shepherd's pie) to the dessert (creme brulee) was excellent. Service is friendly and efficient and they have a nice wine selection. I really can't find anything that I dislike about Beckett's. It's simple, straightforward food at a good price and in a great space. We will be putting into our regular rotation in the neighborhood.

Tl8IK9HlEAZoG1zvk3H7dw.text: Beckett's Table is one of the very best restaruants in the city of Phoenix; need I say any more!

Sh2bpx_UGRoGnqxv0PFOtw.text: Went for my birthday was happy with the short ribs I ordered, creative and trendy menu.

B0_fGdWrge6_5-_qGg72mQ.text: They've updated the menu a bit over the past several weeks, and I'm quite happy with the changes.  Those include a new vegetable entree instead of the vegetable tower and a number of new sides.  Luckily, the roasted pepper/tomato soup remains perfect.

UgOG_H1U97BhLXQcaSrrbA.text: Run, don't walk to eat here. So, so tasty. Comfort food with an upscale twist. Grits and sausage is a must. As is the chicken and dumplings. Chocolate covered bacon for dessert!

BmoZfFMm67IZh9-_Qf8C6A.text: Super tasty place -I go to Beckett's Table several times a month, and each and every time Beckett's delivers.  I love the surprise of looking on the specials board to see what Chef and Company has created.  The staff are very attentive and know the menu items in and out.  I love the deviled eggs - they are always fresh and hot.  I do not believe that they are microwaved as another reviewer has indicated.  My opinion is the food is fresh, hot, and plated appropriately for the type of cuisine it is.  Beckett's has been reviewed by others appropriately in my opinion, save for the recent 2 star review. It's a great place to take a date, eat with family and/or friends, or dine alone at the bar with the friendly bar staff.  Beckett's is the best!!

Dhfp1s8RdpwUw8zrMLjE0A.text: Started the meal with the grits and sausage   It was fine nothing special.  My son had the Shepard pie. It was soupy and peppery. I had their "signature dish" the fork tender short ribs that where fork tender but super salty and hubs had the osso bucco and enjoyed it. The s'mores with the chocolate covered bacon not worth 1 calorie.  Don't get what all the hype is about.  Like throwing $100 down the toilet.

GBp4AcQouN6gqePh1wUT5A.text: I have been wanting to try this restaurant for a long time and finally did.  I had very high expectations and most of them were met. Very large and roomy inside. Lots of space between tables. Love the simplicity of the tables. White cloth, simple glasses, little vase with a fresh, simple flower.  Decor was simplistic. Earthy, environmentally friendly looking and a bit retro in some respects.   The waiter was professional and friendly. He was happy to give suggestions.  The help was amazing. Always refilling our water glasses even though we had a bottle of water on the table. We never filled our glasses ourselves. The staff stayed on top of everything.   Wedge salad was pretty good with the Green Goddess dressing. I'm not sure what the bitterness was from though.  Grilled cheese appetizer was delicious.  I ordered the mahi special.  I'm not sure why the shrimp in it tasted like it was previously frozen. My dish was nothing special but the ambience and service made up for it.  I would go back to see what else I could try.  I'd be up for another adventure.

uqxXi_FIel7eSlKJW384Gw.text: Horrible service!  Been there twice and both times the waiters were arrogant and rude.  Will not split checks for large groups...utterly LAZY!  Will NOT go back.

kQYG1mc0pwJoyuYvlOjQRg.text: Great looking restaraunt and bar with open kitchen and large staff who were mostly male and easy on the eyes.Group shared several appetizer and were impressed anything with schrieners sausage is a can't miss .I ordered the mussels which were excellent.and ordered the s'mores w bacon dessert which was delicious  although a bit difficult to manage.

llNl6ZV_uSQNIcK-8MlZmg.text: Thrice I have visited Beckett's Table, and thrice I have enjoyed it. The vibe is cool, modern, and mellow. The first time around, we went with a large group of friends. We got the grilled cheese appetizer to start, and then I ordered the chicken and dumplings. The appetizer was rich and delicious and I have ordered it every visit since. The chicken and dumplings, however, were underwhelming, which is probably why I had forgotten about them when I went the second time and ordered them again. The chicken and dumplings is the sole reason Beckett's doesn't get a five stars from me. I mean, if the meal wasn't good the first time, and then a year later they haven't improved it or removed it from the menu, then that's your bad, Beckett's Table. Even the waiter tonight admitted to it being bland (although he said it in a much kinder way). Tonight, however, I remembered to stray from the plain, boring meal that had plagued me the two previous times, and ordered the short ribs instead. Good golly, what a difference that little meal made! It was absolutely delicious and could easily be pulled apart by my fork alone. The short ribs melted in my mouth along with the creamy mashed potatoes. Seriously good. The service tonight was also right on par. Our table of six never ran low on drinks, and our server was quite patient with all of the questions we had regarding the menu and specials. My mother-in-law enjoyed the experience tonight so much, that she asked to speak directly with the manager to tell her how wonderful the service and food was. Beckett's Table, you're lucky I waited so long to write this review - It wouldn't have been as glowing last time. But you have earned yourself a solid 4, maybe even 4.5, stars from this girl.

4CLJYcmiubT6oeNs3SWIIg.text: How often do you find a restaurant that provides service comparable to the finest restaurant in town, prices that are surprisingly reasonable, a fun but intimate ambience, and food that is creatively prepared and a joy to eat? Becketts Table has struck just the right chord and each time we've been there we left happy happy happy.  A  lot of their dishes are prepared with bacon and other delectable but not so healthy ingredients, and eating health consciously in a restaurant can often be a drag leaving one wanting. Not this last visit. The sea bass was prepared beautifully and was perfectly satisfying. I did take a bite of the biscuits and they were heavenly. But a bite was all I needed. Especially since I ordered a side of spinach spaetzle, which is the best way yet to eat your veggies. The only problem we encountered was parking. A little guidance would have been helpful as we drove up to a very small and very full lot. In a sheer stroke of luck, someone was leaving as we arrived and we got the one open spot. Pity the party that arrived just after us.

rKk6aiVRN5k3vm9fZJTFsQ.text: It was a great, all-around experience. The food was fantastic. First, my girlfriend and I started with the grits and sausage. I have never had grits as creamy and smooth as these. The sausage was cooked well and had an amazing flavor. The Osso Bucco was very tender and the sides were great. The Mac and Cheese side dish is a must. We finished the night with the death by chocolate, which apparently changes every week. Very cool. Excellent service... good job Mike. We will be repeat customers and are probably their best advertising campaign.

P01ptOkrOPYZyhiMm_qExQ.text: Wow...what a birthday!  My friends and I had the best time and the best meal!  We started at the bar with specialty drinks and great appetizers for happy hour...then on to our dinner table for flash-fried dungeness crab, short ribs with mashed potatoes and several other entrees. I could go on and on...but I'll end with dessert...smores!  Loved my birthday!!

v7Litc20SEd6cUUr_2HKCg.text: Great new restaurant in Phoenix!  The atmosphere is laid back and very cool.  The service was fantastic and the food was excellent.  We tried a good mix of items - the rock shrimp, corn and butternut squash enchiladas, roasted brussel sprouts, osso buco, veggie tower and chicken and dumplings.  Everything was great including the delicious bread!

LiPGj18-8wkZOWcSnQ98_w.text: I really want to like Beckett's Table.  Great location.  Good look inside and out.  The food is good.  Short ribs, salmon,  risotto and chicory coffee creme brulee were all good to very good last night.   The problem is the service.  I have eaten there three times in the last year and every time, the service sucked.  Slow. Slow. Slow.  Inattentive.  Ten minutes to deliver a beer.  What appeared to be "the regulars" were getting a lot of attention.   Too bad.  Three strikes your out.

LYamgaPXaKKO4i8HcZG5aA.text: Trust me - we are foodies from NYC, in Phoenix for the World Baseball Classic and Spring training. We were blown away by Beckett's Table. It's not just the food which is consistent and amazing. (we went twice in one weekend) It's not just the wine program brilliantly managed by Miss Katie. It's not just the attentive service. It's the total experience. If you like food- conscientiously sourced, skillfully prepared, and creatively presented and if you like a wine list created with knowledge, intentionality and affordability then Beckett's Table is for you. The Brussels sprouts, the kale salad, the short ribs, the osso, the wines - all home runs!

XKDtGvGdg4dVE9_46HLG4Q.text: The drinks were great, the food was good. The best thing was their breakdown of a s'more with chocolate covered bacon.

Z_v3_tHIpo6BaOgGwex7Ag.text: The best service I have received from a local restauarant in a LONG time. Greeted at the door and qucikly you can feel the positive vibe circling the room. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas and a palmaire cocktail (awesome), Hubby had a painkiller and mini grilled cheese with side of tomato red pepper soup. You get a hot fresh bread basket along side of honey butter. TO DIE! definately worth another visit even if it's for drinks and dessert.

wMNp9udyueLXy1fFMUplcg.text: Always have a nice experience here. Really good comfort food. The Osso Bucco was delicious!

soHWQ9x7wEOc3d3wgGNxUw.text: A friend of ours from out of town planned a dinner here for 9 people last Friday night. After reading the reviews, I was excited to go to Beckett's Table. We may not have gone here on our own because the location is pretty out of our way, but I am glad we did. Our server, Brandon, was awesome! He was knowledgeable and helpful, and he made our visit extra enjoyable. My hubby and I showed up on time while the rest of our party was running late. Rather than punish us for being there on time, the hostesses sat us immediately. We ordered our drinks and the grilled cheese and tomato soup appetizers. What a great idea! I thought it might be a bit strange for an appetizer, but it was the perfect amount of food to tide us over until our party arrived. We dipped the sandwich into the creamy, spicy soup.  YUMMY! After our party arrived, they ordered appetizers. I did not try the roasted feta appetizer, but it looked delish and my friends really enjoyed it. My main course was as good as the appetizer. I had the flank steak. Usually a flank steak is not the best cut of meat, but this steak was excellent!! Thickly cut and tender; this steak was perfectly prepared. We will definitely return to this place, and we will request to sit in Brandon's section.

zEEn7wowQzPEoJlf0EXqLg.text: Above all, the food stood out in what was a memorable dining experience. Mussels were sublime, very tender but not mushy, in a sauce that complimented the shellfish well. Seems to be a solid choice for a great dinner. The service was friendly, attentive and prompt. Will be back next time I'm in town.

ANVg_ijLuxhAUZJTe4eFyg.text: The dessert was wonderful - some rhubarb thing with ice-cream.  The food :-|

WW-3U6HrktVjV43ioOz3Ew.text: It was my friends birthday. We have heard about Beckett's table and we were excited to go. There are so many great restaurants in Phoenix, we heard this was good.  They have a limited specific menu. That is fine by us. But what is unacceptable is to be out of one item on this limited menu. We ordered it and were told they were out. When the manager approached we let her know we were disappointed and all we received was an invitation to next time preorder the item when we make our next reservation. There will not be another reservation from us or those we take to dinner. AGAIN there are too many great restaurants in Phoenix that not only have exceptional food but service as well. The manager said they run out of this item normally and it is made from scratch. If this is a constant issue? fix it. You may say food cost etc as the excuse but seriously I am sure this item does not cost that much.  Yes it was good food. Yes our server was good. Will I make a reservation and give the secret code to hold an item, no. Will I be back maybe. For now We will move on and not look back.

5fQncr4c_G96PBzoLWzQTA.text: Great ambience, food and service. Joanne, our server was great at giving advice to make the perfect selections. I would highly recommend trying this restaurant.

RSoi2YCVWWAhs-pazkckkw.text: Go here, it doesn't disappoint! The menu change's, so you always try something new. They do a lot of root vegetables and everything is fresh. They have special cocktails so be sure to see Joe the bartender! I had the short ribs and was amazed of the flavor and the amount of beef, had to share it! I am definitely a regular!

4iBvmrBxaascXdtgHUtbqw.text: The most incredible food! The service is high-end without the pretentious atmosphere. Very casual ambiance. Been here several times, our favorite restaurant!    PS The review below about not splitting the checks.Beckett's clearly posts this on their website and she could have done better planning or communication beforehand. My 2 cents.

A1_1jo0xtucZuJv9tjK_Rw.text: I did not leave tonight in love with Beckett's table. My friend and I were in the mood for coffee and dessert and used the mighty Yelp to look at the menu beforehand and at the sight of "brown butter cake" my friend was sold.  Take a seat on the (loud) patio and quite a few minutes go by. Our server comes to take drinks -- waters for now and we look over the menu. He leaves for another 10 minutes; it must've been noticed by the manager (or perhaps the owner?) bc she came over to ask if we'd gotten drinks. Maybe I used the wrong word bc I asked if she had anything other than "run-of-the-mill" coffee (read: coffee plain vs latte). She seemed taken aback and goes, "oh, of course it's great; it's a Nicaraguan blend sourced here in Cave Creek". Calm down, I just wanted to know if it would be coffee with creamer or a latte.  We ended sharing a few apps before dessert: Mac - best part of the meal. I could have done without the prosciutto but not a big deal. Grilled cheese - good, but not overwhelmingly amazing. Not a huge fan of the soup due to the sweetness. Sprouts - I wish they didn't have the bacon in it but they were cooked well.  Then we come to dessert. We asked for the brown butter cake and the waiter looks at us like we have four heads. "I have worked here for 3 years and nothing like that. We had ice cream once before". I explained that it was part of their yelp menu and showed him -- he did not seem too interested and did not bother to ask someone else if it had been one of their seasonal menu items. We end up getting the Cracker Jack dessert that is supposed to be caramel-y. Neither of us could really taste the caramel. If not for the Cracker Jacks or chocolate drizzle this would not have much flavor.  The waiter came back and asked us how it was -- we told him we were on the fence. He said we could send it back and get something else so we took him up on that. Ordered the lemon tart. Way too tart and that confectioner sugar gives this a box-y/plastic aftertaste.   Overall? I give it a "meh".

iSfjOwtc4scbqdkazl5ZNQ.text: Very mediocre restaurant with expensive prices for what you get. (Especially the scallops) Service was good.

mvNarbTQRIgOwKqtshK1HA.text: Two words: Chef Jeff   Jeff is a #younggenius. He is so personable with each of the guests and makes everyone feel so welcome.  I loved the half off Arizona wine and apps we  had. Great service from very attentive servers. Rachel who has waited on me before came over and said "hi" - it was nice to be remembered. She's great.   5 stars all day, every day.

HEvpIAj_CQ_u9ThP6znJOQ.text: Never, ever disappointing!  This place is not only consistent, but a place you wouldn't expect in Phoenix; I would see this is San Fran or Santa Barbara!  Wow!  The osso bucco is delish as well as the short ribs, organic vegetable dish and the desserts!!!  This will be and is my place to come for a nice place to have dinner.  GREAT variety of nice wines!  50+ glasses to choose by the glass and a reserve bottle list.  Don't pass this place up! Locally owned and operated as well as cared about!

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deep fried deviled eggs

dt08vvcPO85oXIIUORqnWw.text: Absolutely excellent. I had the ox tail and it was superb. The hostess also assisted the waiting staff when she wasn't seating people.

FBMDARkG7n4waCkSnqNoCw.text: Excellent food and cocktails here.  The dining room has a great feel and the dishes were very flavorful. You can really tell this chef takes his food seriously.  I'll be back fo-sho

I5eR3SyBynfn_k0Actr_Tw.text: Received an invite from a group of my friends to join them at Beckett's Table for Restaurant Week 2014. I was excited to experience this restaurant of which I had heard so much about.   My friend who made the reservation communicated quite a list of "regulations" back to us that were given to her over the phone. "No credit cards, one tab, you have to sit outside," etc. We laughed off the Nazi-like first impression, but all got cash out to respect their wishes.   I arrived a little later than the rest of my party (10 total) and as I greeted my friends, was abruptly confronted by the waitress, "It's time to order. Take your seat." She then only handed me the restaurant week specials instead of a full menu. Although I had planned to order something else, I felt pressured to participate in the special to make things a little easier on the waitress who was showing obvious signs of irritation.  While our lovely waitress was taking our order, we had one last friend show up for dinner. As someone stood up to allow her to sit next to a friend she knows, the waitress yelled over the top of our table, "No switching seats!" Startled and a little appalled, I couldn't help but laugh in disbelief. The waitress then made a big scene counting out loud, rolling her eyes and huffing loudly. We stated she could just bring the food in whatever order it was originally listed and we would pass it to the correct person. With a forced smile and over enthusiastic tone, she proclaimed it was no problem and she would make it work.   Our last friend was ordering off the full menu to accommodate her vegetarian diet. When asking our waitress for a recommendation between a few dishes, the waitress rolled her eyes and began naming off the printed ingredients loudly then saying, "if you like all that, then you'll like this."  With our group being sensitive to our size, we tried to be as accommodating and gracious as possible to eliminate any additional stress. When it came time to pay the tab, we were prepared to pay with cash but the waitress stated it would be easier to split up the bill since most everyone ordered off the set menu. After turning in our cards, it took her and the management team over 15 minutes to bring our cards back, stating the system was slow. I wouldn't dock stars for this normally because things like that do happen, but after being treated like inmates rather than patrons of a "fine establishment," I am just done with this.  Service is a big factor for me, but I left three stars because if I remember, the food was pretty good. Sadly, the only taste left in my mouth is bitter from the way were treated.  While I have no current desire to revisit this restaurant, I would like to try it one more time to see if maybe the food tastes better without a grumpy hag for a waitress.

kKEKn0os58ybr_PamiREOw.text: We've been here multiple times before and should have written a rave review then because the food is and always has been amazing; however, I just finished dinner and felt inspired to write a review immediately!  My wife recently acquired a GI condition and becketts is by far the most accommodating place we've been to. Rebecca (sp?), our server was extremely nice and helpful!   This is an exemplary place for both food and service! Kudos to you Becketts!!

UlHWsDIcUnUwQwqvT8ZHeA.text: I really like this place. Went with some girlfriends on a Sunday night, which features half-price Arizona wines. Our waiter gave us a great recommendation that turned us into AZ wine lovers. We started out sharing the deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts with bacon, and the sausage and grits. Flavors were really good. I could eat that sausage and grits for a meal, though it was just a tad too "soupy" this particular night.   After filling up on wine and appies, my friend and I split the burger and the vegetable chop salad. This burger is exceptional! Chopped bacon flecks throughout the beef, perfectly medium, Caramelized onions, soft egg bun. Delicious! The chopped veg salad was the perfect, light counterpoint to that decadent burger. Our other friend had the short ribs, which she loved. It was a large serving; she couldn't finish it.  As if that weren't enough, we dove into dessert with enthusiasm. Not sure why but I wanted to try the pecan fig pie. I usually only have pie at the holidays but I was curious. Oh my! Yes, it was sweet, but not cloyingly so. The figs provided a nice, chewy twist.. But the best part was a bite of that pie with the accompanying cream cheese lemon zest ice cream. It's the perfect sweet/tart mouthful, you absolutely must try it!   Kudos to our waiter, who struck exactly the right chord with gracious service, helpful advice, and a truly pleasant demeanor.   I will be back!

fPUtW-M391s7YrVBYGRBdQ.text: My boyfriend and I decide to meet in Phoenix for dinner and we Yelped and found Beckett's. He is actually the one who found it :) I wanted to go to another place, but I'm really really happy that we went with Beckett's. We got there right around 5:00pm the beautiful hotesses greeted us and seated us right away. I would suggest making one though, because the place filled up pretty quickly. We were seated and given menus and the our server let us know about the Restaurant Week Special for $33 We looked and it offered almost everything we wanted to try. SOLD! We decided upon the pork to appetizer, the short rib dinner, and the red velvet cream cheese icing cake. The server also suggested a goat cheese appetizer and I'm so glad that she did! It was a flavor explosion!!! Actually everything was, the meats were cooked to perfection and pulled apart so nicely and each bite left you wanting more. We left very satisfied. They had a great variety of beers, wines, and of course they had an apple cider...cause you know me and my ciders....which was the Woodchuck amber, smooth and sweet ...just how I like it:) I hope we take another trip to Phoenix so that we can eat at Beckett's again! Try to take advantage of their special going on right now! Thanks Beckett's!

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Rib
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Goat cheese appetizer

fy2AgVX0JJiDTkL6QfEwAg.text: Out of the dozen restaurants I visited while in Phoenix, this one topped the list. I was with a large group and we ordered every appetizer, entree, and desert on the menu. Every single one of these puppies motivated our group to moan and groan like Meg Ryan did in Harry Met Sally. Yes! Yes! Yes!!! Put this at the top of your "must try list" when you come to Phoenix my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh Lord was this good!
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak that will bring you to tears with it&#39;s deliciousness.
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oso bucco! Oh my!

gAh2CkOy2vuPk3CISSwk1w.text: Food was delicious. God that pecan pie pastry might just be the end of my diet plan. Oh God, that icecream on top of it was just mmm mmm...damn cravings.   The bread was fresh off the oven, the butter was nice and smooth, the food kept coming out nice and prompt and... wait for it... 1/2 off local wines on Sundays  So why did I dock the star - the service could have been a bit better. Perhaps its the superlative experience with the food, perhaps its me and I am hyper critical when it comes to service. Here's the first bit - How do you serve food and forget the silverware. See, I can agree it might have been oversight, but its a restaurant, its all you do. That i expect to get without asking for.    I would give it 4.5 if I could but I cant, so I will give it 4 and say this much - I will be back and I will want to give them a five :)

5GcDihk5sq9Ip7xM4LMjkQ.text: Unfortunately we did not enjoy our experience with the food here, as stated in previous ratings the food was very attractive on the menu but once it arrived at our table it was all quite different. We were very impressed with the service, ambiance and location but the food is borderline cafeteria and very overpriced. Starting with the mac & cheese with panchetta- virtually flavorless, panchetta was burnt. Second the stuffing...dry, burnt on top, cold inside and again flavorless. Third (and fourth) the mussels, bland, all we tasted was tomato, and the short ribs, basically beef stew meat on top of plain mashed potatoes. The best part of my meal was the draught Stella Artois, we skipped dessert in fear of what we would get. We will not return.

wnWINOAM8tfyZbHVlG0Vqw.text: One of those fancy hipster places that uses unique ingredients.  In my opinion all the flavors fell short.. either it was dry and flavorful or bland with the right texture.  The appetizers were good but I don't think I have the urge to come try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chefs special- pork belly
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short ribs

ZUwTZfaOYrl0-totBAYFow.text: Beckett's has been on our radar and tonight we managed to snag a table. The ambience is great, my daughter pointed out all the pigs hidden in the rafters during dinner (something most guests won't search for!). We started with their deviled eggs which today were bacon jam, celery heart, and pecan... delicious! Our 8 year old ate two whole eggs. Also shared the noble bread with mushrooms, figs, and house made ricotta, pretty good, maybe not something I'd order again. My Mom got the roasted red pepper soup (enough to share for 4!) and oh so good! Served so warm in a warm huge soup bowl, a meal in itself. For our entrees, the burger (amazing), the Short Rib (possibly the best we've had in Arizona and we eat a LOT of short rib), the mashed potatoes and vegetables on that dish were great! My husband ordered the Vegetable Enchiladas which did not disappoint, he also (I know right?!) ordered the Green Pork Stew (which I ended up eating too) which was PERFECT! The green chili had a tingling spice on the tongue but so sweet at the same time leaving you wanting more and more. We were just blown away by the variety of entrees we ordered and how great everything was. Dessert: Flourless chocolate cake (in my opinion you need the flour so this was my least favorite item of the night), the Fig and Pecan pie (ORDER IT!), the chocolate covered bacon smores (bacon was great, how could it not be), but again not my favorite dessert, the marshmallows were hard, maybe torched then put back into a fridge(?), it just didn't wow me like I had hoped. Overall, the wine selection is killer and we definitely will be back! Service was on point, thanks Beckett's for a great meal!

n81H7SrUXcpLCHzBgrnVsg.text: Well I added one star because I had a great time celebrating our anniversary with our children and family. I awarded one more star for the deviled eggs oh no more stars!  Good because the rest of the meal wasn't with it. The chef must have a dead palate in that mustard in mac and cheese?  osso bucco with pork spaetzle with rosemary not great. Cheeseburger greasy inside and out.  Ice tea was good So overpriced and so so good food.  Not good

ikXU_KIqrjaq74LeLgPc-Q.text: Went to Beckett's for a date night. Made reservations but they did seat us a little late for our set time. Overall great experience. Tried 3 dishes. Mac n cheese was first as the appetizer. They have changed this dish up a bit. No longer baked in a skillet but still a very tasty pasta. The mustard seeds added a nice kick & I would definitely recommend the pancetta. I had the salmon dish. Loved the fish! The grains were a bit simple for the dish but nonetheless I finished my plate. My boyfriend orders the short rib dish which was the best out of the 3. No knife needed with this entree. Meat was cooked perfectly. Amazing flavors and very filling. If we had room I would have loved to try the famous desserts. Will be back to try more for sure.

t2EziHxZbEtXsSEkkkAs_A.text: Excellent chef.....creative menu that affords not only impeccable presentation and quality ingredients, it utilizes fresh and local ingredients whenever in season and available.  The ambience is casual yet classy and the service was perfect......very educated with the menu and there when needed!  This is a must experience if you know and love food and wine.  Loved the bar and community tables also!  Enjoy.......P.S. make a reservation

YYh4mzUkp1YYBhG8K_sl7A.text: Sunday funday.  Classy style.   Half off bottles of Arizona wine and live music.  Bummer the full wine list wasn't on special.   All of the dishes we ordered were amazing.   Mac and cheese was a stand out!

bMU9QlyszcQeCJ_Mb7x7Xw.text: The fig-pecan pie may have magical properties. The ice cream that accompanies it is surely the most perfect substance in the universe.  Beckett's Table has that magical quality of the most cherished dining experiences in Paris or Milan. It's unfussy yet beautifully courteous and efficient. My pork osso buco confit was the kind of delicious where you eat it slowly to prolong the delight -- and that takes effort because it's so so good.  My full dinner with dessert took about an hour, and I never felt rushed nor overlooked. Everything was wonderful, half-price Arizona wine by the bottle is an excellent deal, and I strongly recommend the Sunday Unplugged acoustic music program.

OrvtUKrwBDc3tCdrLsemgw.text: Excellent place..... but, little pricey for what you get, on the other hand, these are probably normal portion sizes. Food was great! I had a veggie platter that was so tasty!!! The cornbread app was awesome but damn it was very very small portion! Choices of beer were good

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Av30WjbRh10x6MiVvgqKYQ.text: My wife and I got reservations via yelp. Walked right in great table in back. We split the scallops and had the grilled cheese for a appetizer. The fog and pecan pie for desert.  The price was good with tip under 60.  The atmosphere was casual and comfortable. Must visit.

04lYQ_eDvDCLY8LPq4Bz-w.text: We met with friends for dinner here and everything was delicious. They have gourmet versions of comfort food. I ordered short ribs (amazing an tender) and my husband really enjoyed the green chili pork stew. The chocolate flourless cake had an amazing butterscotch sauce. Huge selection of wines and spirits. The service was a little slow and they had the heat outside cranked on a bit too high, so I'm giving this four stars, but the food was definitely five star-worthy.

_Fc2c3K59YGc4HYclfMk6A.text: I was here years ago and never came back. The reason isn't because of the food or service or ambiance, but I was on a blind first date and it was awful. Honestly, I don't even remember much about the food and restaurant because the date was just so bad.   My colleague brought up going to Becketts Table for a dinner after work and I wasn't opposed to it because frankly, I needed to try it again and write a review. We had our reservation right when they opened so the restaurant was empty. The restaurant is a lot bigger and more open than what I remember.   I first ordered the beets appetizer which the portion was small, but delectable! My entree I ordered the cast iron petite chicken and it did not disappoint. The chicken was tender and juicy and the vegetables that came with it was a perfect combo. I highly recommend.  For dessert, I ordered the chocolate bacon smores. Get ready to get your hands a little dirty, but oh so worth it!!! Beware that prices are on the high side.

Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cast iron petite chicken

dEVyCCNViy5Dn-fk5hk_yA.text: I ordered the bacon cheddar biscuits. These biscuits were just OK,  what made them stand out was the apple honey butter. Next up were the sea scallops which were undercooked, I sent them back. And no I didn't want them cooked more, for $28, I expect my food to come out cooked to perfection. The manager came over with an apology and asked me if I wanted something else she suggested the chopped salad. The salad was good. Last but not least was the bacon bourbon apple cobbler.  They give you a huge portion. The cobbler to ice cream ration is definitely off. I ate 1/4 of it and took the rest to go. Flavorful, but I felt like the apples could have been more tender.  The ambiance is very nice. Our waitress Bethany was great. But due to the flavor of the food or should I say lack of flavor, I will not be back. With so many restaurants to try in Phoenix, mediocre is not going to cut it!

4-DazjWx-ajK4sbenQnClQ.text: We are from out of town and thought to give this place a try after looking at some pictures on Yelp. Ambiance was nice, super super nice staff! Loved our waotier, forgot his name but he was awesome (had a beard with light blue eyes...good looking ). We thought their food was just mediocre esp. for the price, but the service and workers were awesome and that's always a plus in my !   Had the following: - child's chicken strips (good and crunchy) - fork tendor short ribs (a little to salty for my taste buds, but it was tasty!) - pan seared scallops (needed a bit more seasoning on the scallops, but overall it was good) - chocolate dipped bacon s'mores (love love love their home made marshmallows! It was delicious and different) - roasted garlic and black pepper spaetzle (super delicious!!) - deviled egg of the day (a teaser since I love deviled egg)

photos.caption: Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids chicken strips. Very crunchy! Daughter absolutely loved it! (She&#39;s 2)
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted garlic and black pepper spaetzle. Sooo delicious! Must try!
Photo of Beckett's Table - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deviled egg. Love deviled eggs no matter its shape or how it&#39;s made...delicious

qoNGZMoij0tHnumhYLcw5g.text: My brother was in town for a visit and I wanted to go out to a place near my home. I suggested we go to Beckett's Table and it turned out to be a great idea and a wonderful relaxed dinner for the two of use to visit and enjoy drinks and food.  He couldn't believe they had Shrimp and Grits on the menu and told me it was fabulous! ^ large shrimp and grits in a savory sauce. I went for the spare ribs which are incredible, tender, flavorful and delicious. I wish they had been more generous with the wine sauce. I just loved it.  My margarita left a bit to be desired but was ok. The service was friendly and spot on. We shared a chop salad and creme' Brule and they were both very good. I will be returning for sure!

Y2yPqHhVj1T7sXMnC-DsHg.text: I wanted to give this restaurant a higher rating and would have if the service would have been better. On the positive side, the food was very good, the restaurant itself fun, cool inside, nice patio. We were party of 6....between us we had 3 appetizers, the scallop entree, the salmon entree and the short rib entree...all tasty, hot and delicious.  On the down side, after we were seated we waited and waited and waited for our server to come...never did. So we asked bus boy if we could order some drinks.  Finally a manager or similar came over and took our drink order. Drinks arrived and then finally server did too.  He was ok...not overly pleasant or service oriented and not helpful when it came to suggestions or recommendations.  He or someone forgot one of our appetizers until we asked for it - it came after all other appetizers gone...and then our entrees arrived right after. We never did receive complimentary bread....never even knew about it. I would go back...hopefully service will be better next time.

80tAtAie-VLtJJwpDyawFw.text: Went during restaurant week, and the food was really good! Service was so bad however. We were there for hours, and it took ages to get our waitress to take our orders for any course or to get the check. Menu also seems fairly limited

vy5R0u7llRNbE1YEBgkNRQ.text: I have so much love for this place. It's hands down my favorite restaurant in Arizona.  Here is why: -Very cool and fun inside, very comforting and relaxing atmosphere. Outdoor seating is great too. Love the open kitchen too! You can see the chefs cooking! -Service is just top notch, can't tell you how happy the staff makes me every single time I go there. Very professional -Great drinks from wine to beer to whatever! All 5 stars from me. -Food is just amazing, smaller menu but everything is perfect. You can expect amazing quality every single time you go there. Never once have had a bad meal. I've had so many things to name but my all time favorite which they don't have anymore, was the chicken and dumplings. (Bring it back ;) ) -Pricing is a great value for what you're getting. Very fair and well worth!  Their restaurant week menu was a great deal as well! Brought my family and girlfriend and they all loved it! They all want to go back.  The chef/owner Justin Beckett is an absolute bad ass. So much respect for this guy. Keep it up!

KN9JLdoOUpYGAXhp4Y2gIg.text: My husband and I enjoyed a savory dinner here on Saturday night.  The atmosphere was warm and friendly.  We were seated inside, but the outside patio looked very inviting, especially the tables by the fire.   Our daughter recommended the Original Grilled Cheese, so we tried it as an app.  The tasty sandwich is made up of four cheeses with a layer of pancetta in the middle.  Included was a tomato red pepper soup for dipping.  It was delicious. The bread was perfectly crisped. I might ordered it as an entree next time and the server said that it could be done, and that it would come with a bowl of that yummy soup. Our entrees were excellent.  My husband ordered the short ribs and I ordered the pan seared scallops.  The scallops were some of the best that I have ever eaten.  They were cooked perfectly, and the little sear on the top was sweet and spicy, I think with cinnamon.  I think that it is difficult to get scallops right, but they did.  The short ribs were juicy and fork tender.  In addition to good proteins, the veggies were excellent.  The butternut squash puree that was the base for the carrots, onions and cashews on the scallop plate was just sweet enough.

e83S6hc35NwlNZ_Jx1IuOA.text: Not at all what I expected and rather disappointing.  I've waited a long time to dine at BT.  I've always tried to find an excuse to go.  So for Mother's Day each year, I pick a fancy restaurant and we go.  I decided to go to BT this year.  As my kiddo whispered upon arrival, "This isn't fancy, there's no white table cloth."  Haha, correct.  But still, I loved the very open and airy decor of the space.  The exposed beams gave it a lofty lodge feel.  Fortunately, they had plenty of parking, often times an issue in the CenPho and Arcadia areas.  We arrived moments before our reservation and were seated promptly.  Our server was very attentive.  He came right over, offered suggestions and offered small talk about the day.  He was a great server.  We ordered the bacon cheddar biscuits and expected light fluffy moist biscuits, but I will caution you not to expect that.  The biscuits are rustic and not fluffy at all.  They were hard, in fact.  Unfortunately, and I'm sure you can guess, we didn't find the biscuits pleasing to our palates at all.  For our entrees, we tried a Steamed Bass and the Mac and Cheese.  The steamed bass came over a mixture of veggies, including broccoli and other root veggies.  The fish entree was edible.  My child didn't find the Mac and cheese pleasing at all and therefore didn't eat it.  I wanted to love this place as so many do.  Alas, none of our food was good to us there.  Definitely not good enough to make a repeat trip.  However, great server and atmosphere.  Return Factor: 20%

dz5kJKHDjLOpI0-HojHkFg.text: The Bad:  -Service; We arrived just as they opened the doors, and despite it only being the two of us we were forced to sit at the bar in very uncomfortable chairs because we didn't have reservations. We assumed this meant they were booked for the night, but when we left nearly 2 hours later the place was still half empty - seems like they could've spared a small table for us. Our bartender wasn't around much either, and seemed like he was always off somewhere else.  -Entree; Both my boyfriend and I ordered the scallops, which was $28 each. To our disappointment, this hefty price only included 4 scallops on the plate, a small spoonful of puree, and nearly half a dozen other assorted bits of food that didn't go very well together. I was tempted to send it back and ask for something else, but since our only waiter was the bartender we didn't see him much when walked off. For nearly $30 we expected something much better.  -Dessert; We split the chocolate-covered bacon s'mores, and we thought it would come already put together or at least be a fairly neat plate - nope! We had to tear up the frozen chocolate-covered bacon and graham crackers ourselves and assemble the s'more, which only succeeded in getting our hands very dirty and sticky by the end. It didn't even taste good, so definitely wasn't worth it.  -Out-dated menus; We were here the Sunday after Valentine's Day, about half a week later, but they hadn't even bothered to change their menus promoting a special Valentine's dinner. Things like this are just lazy, and I'd expect it from a grimy drive-thru place, not a fairly pricey restaurant like this one.  The Good: -Appetizers; Both the grilled cheese and mac & cheese were wonderful. I could eat a huge bowl of the mac for an entree, and probably should've.  -Music; There was live music playing on the night we ate here, and she gave out free CDs and shirts. So at least we felt like we got our money's worth after those scallops... almost.  -Drinks; Sitting at the bar made it easier to order drinks starting out, and at least those were good and arrived quickly - though making a mixed drink isn't exactly difficult. We probably would've gotten more, but since our bartender/waiter kept disappearing that didn't happen.  Overall, I'm very disappointed by our experience at this restaurant, which is unfortunate because we'd heard good things about it from our friends, but our time here proves otherwise. There were some positives, but not nearly enough to make up. I doubt we'll be returning.

uYVP8pZtBgVs1OTjy4u0RA.text: Recently moved to the neighborhood so tried this spot on the reviews! This place is awesome love the ambiance and the food was so amazing we may be back tomorrow. The HH polenta was killer and the wine was a great pour and one of my favorites. The bar staff was attentive and have no problem going back tomorrow night or any other time.  Must try spot!

9HWoGwSJTcHZ3MFJn8v2EA.text: Besides having the cutest table flower ever...dinner was amazing Beckett's Table. Brad and I's first time here. I ate the corn soup so fast I didn't take a picture...it's was the best soup I've ever had. I had the soup, short rib, and flourless chocolate cake. Brad had the schreiners local sausage, pork loin, and coconut pudding. We shared the Mac n cheese as well.
